channel.title: POLITICO Influence
channel.description: Delivered daily, Influence gives you a comprehensive rundown and analysis of all lobby hires and news on K Street.

item.title: Tariffs struck down but trade fights continue
item.description: President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs are no longer in effect.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Crypto optimistic for compromise with banks
item.description: Cryptocurrency companies and big banks may finally be approaching a compromise on stablecoin yield payments.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: TelevisaUnivision, Versant tap new DC chiefs
item.description: A pair of prominent media outlets have new leaders for their government relations shops in D.C. TelevisaUnivision has tapped Bernadette Carrillo to lead its D.C. office as senior vice president of government relations.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: K Street snags another Hill tax aide
item.description: Cozen O’Connor Public Strategies has added Sean Clerget as a senior principal.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Swiss billionaire’s nonprofit funding at issue in Nebraska House race
item.description: Allegations of foreign influence have entered the crowded Nebraska race to replace retiring GOP centrist Rep. Don Bacon.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Lippman
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Lippman

item.title: K Street mines critical minerals
item.dc:creator: By Marcia Brown
item.dc:contributor: By Marcia Brown

item.title: America First Policy Institute buys $20M DC building
item.description: The Trump-aligned America First Policy Institute (AFPI) bought the historic Colorado Building at 14th and G NW — massively expanding its footprint in Washington just steps away from the White House.
item.dc:creator: By Alex Gangitano
item.dc:contributor: By Alex Gangitano

item.title: Shapiro stepping down as CTA chief
item.description: The Consumer Technology Association’s Gary Shapiro is stepping down as CEO of the trade group after 35 years at the helm.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Netflix hires another antitrust lobbyist
item.description: Kressin Powers’ Perry Apelbaum, a longtime top Democratic lawyer on the House Judiciary Committee, began lobbying for Netflix last month on antitrust issues in the tech industry.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Iceland lobbies up after ‘52nd state’ crack
item.description: The Icelandic government has hired Brownstein Hyatt Farber Schreck to represent the island in Washington.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Whatley's windfall
item.description: North Carolina Republican Senate candidate Michael Whatley has praised the Trump administration for its ouster of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Lippman and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Lippman and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: DC golf course operator lobbies up
item.description: The nonprofit that oversees Washington’s three public golf courses has lobbied up as it prepares to fight President Donald Trump’s move to take over the courses.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Netflix adds another outside firm
item.description: Netflix has added S-3 Group to its bench of hired guns.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Travel industry presses to avoid another shutdown travel mess
item.description: The travel industry — still reeling from last year’s record-breaking shutdown — is pleading with lawmakers to keep the current, partial shutdown as short as possible.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Kazakhstan hires Continental
item.description: Continental Strategy, the firm founded by former Donald Trump campaign adviser Carlos Trujillo, has been hired to represent the government of Kazakhstan.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Forward Global announces Venezuela task force
item.description: Global public affairs and risk advisory firm Forward Global has launched a new advisory group dedicated to helping clients navigate the rapidly changing political and commercial climate in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Julie Johnson's flip-flop on congressional stock trading
item.description: The debate about banning members of Congress from trading stocks has jumped to the campaign trail.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Lippman, Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Lippman, Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Biofuels use Iowa visit to woo Trump
item.description: As Donald Trump travels to Iowa to speak about energy and the economy, tensions remain high over the future of ethanol sales after the collapse last week of a push to allow year-round sales of E15 as part of Congress’ spending bill.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Kalshi opens a DC office
item.description: Kalshi has opened an office in D.C. as the online betting giant continues to grow its footprint in the nation’s capital.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: GOP opposition research vet now leading America Rising
item.description: America Rising is now under the stewardship of Matt Wall, who serves as the firm’s owner and president.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Lutnicks’ firm hires Trump Jr. associate
item.description: Firm Cantor Fitzgerald, which was led by Howard Lutnick until his appointment as Commerce secretary, has hired Checkmate Government Relations.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Trump 2.0 unleashes a gusher on K Street
item.description: Donald Trump’s second presidency has ushered in a massive payday for Washington’s top lobbying shops.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Anthropic’s hiring spree
item.description: The maker of the AI chatbot Claude has brought on three new outside lobbying firms since the beginning of December.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Nat Sec veteran heads back to K Street
item.description: President Trump has set his sights on acquiring Greenland, and at least one company with interests in the Danish territory is positioning itself in Washington to seize the moment.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes, Joe Gould and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes, Joe Gould and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Senate Judiciary advances effort to limit foreign influence
item.description: The Senate Judiciary Committee voted to advance a bill that would ban former senior government officials from lobbying for foreign “countries of concern.”
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Generic, biotech lobbies add new outside firms
item.description: The Association for Accessible Medicines, which represents generic drugmakers, is expanding its roster of hired guns.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Ballard launches Western Hemisphere practice
item.description: Ballard Partners has launched a new practice group dedicated to helping clients navigate the geopolitical upheaval under way across the Western Hemisphere.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Manatt picks up another batch of Holland & Knight clients
item.description: Manatt, Phelps & Phillips has registered to lobby for a half-dozen local government clients previously represented by lobbyists who decamped for Holland & Knight last year.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Ballard name gets pulled into Mangione case
item.description: Lawyers for Luigi Mangione, the accused murderer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, are making a novel argument to get their client’s death penalty case thrown out.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Seven Letter expands in LA, NYC and Huntsville
item.description: The move is the firm’s largest expansion to date, raising its total number of offices to five from its current two locations in Washington and Boston.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
